review_title: It's not horrible, but not great pay
pros: The faculty and staff can be great to work with. This all depends on your department though.
cons: Pay is only $15.01 an hour for administrative assistants. No matter how much education or experience you have. You cannot get a raise in your position so there is little incentive to improve your skillset. Organization is not very good. No one knows how to train you so you pretty much have to figure things out as you go and hope the person before you left good enough instructions.

pros: Integration of faith and learning

review_title: My time at Lee was good until a new academic president took over

cons: New academic president didn't value custodians and brought many changes to the department.

pros: How folks are treated and the Esprit de corps

review_title: Beautiful place, great students, not so great pay
pros: It's a lovely campus in a nice enough town. The students are wonderful and rarely cause any kind of issue. I liked the accountability some faculty and staff had due to their faith. The involvement and outreach to the local community was excellent, and the sense of community within the campus was very inclusive and positive.
cons: The pay was sub-par. Many faculty and staff used their "God card" to say and do precisely as they liked, even if it was ridiculous. It's hard to be on staff there and not be a Pentecostal. It's getting better in recent years, but still obvious.

pros:
Good opportunity to share knowledge with fellow students who have difficulties.

Hours are set up between you and your tutee: easy to find something that works for you both.
cons: Tutees' schedules will sometimes create serious conflicts. Also tutees tend to only show up once in a blue moon (resulting in few hours), meaning your hourly minimum wage doesn't add up to much on a paycheck.

pros: Tuition assistance opportunities are good.  There are some perks like use of the gym and free lunch in the cafeteria if you park in designated areas and ride the shuttle.  There is also onsite childcare for a low monthly fee.
cons: Salary is way below market rate and there is very little opportunity for advancement. Health insurance is very expensive and it is a culture reluctant to change.  Investments are made in buildings and aesthetics rather than employees.

pros: You get vacation time sick time and personal time and can also take breaks when you want to.
cons: Pay is not good and management doesnt always stay on top of things and you can never do anything well enough to make them happy.you arent given enough time in the morning to get things ready for when people start coming in.

job_title: Faculty Coordinator of Instructional Technology in Cleveland, TN
pros:
Lee has a community of people that care for each other.
The Lee University environment is always upbeat and positive
On the Lee University campus colleagues may disagree on a matter, yet continue to be friends... and close friends at that.
Opportunities as an employee are almost endless
If you, as an employee, seek to grow, Lee Univ. administration will guide and offer to help.
cons: None so far (after 15+ years)

pros: It generally all depended on what department you were in. Certain supervisors were better at being supervisors than others. Great hours and flexibility.
cons: Same as above, certain supervisors were not as great as others. Some were less understanding than they should have been.

pros: The environment is friendly, real, and making a major difference in peoples' lives.  Additionally, the leadership is top-notch keeping the personnel in mind and demonstrating appreciation in various ways.
cons: The more you put into your work, the more is expected of you.  However, I don't completely see this as a negative, but I know others do,

pros: Lee is a great place to work. Wonderful environment, beautiful campus, and you are doing good work. Meal ticket benefits aren't bad either. Basically free lunch every day! Plus, if you work there a year they pay for your masters from Lee.
cons: Low pay. If you work for Lee, odds are you are not in it for the money.

job_title: Coordinator for Service Learning in Cleveland, TN
pros: Great environment with kind, motivated people. Many opportunities for professional growth and collaborating across departments. Family-friendly culture and concern for spiritual and personal care.
cons: Common to be underpaid for any position. Expectations for lifestyle and representing the university's beliefs and values. Compared to other universities, some departments are not as academically or professionally rigorous.

pros: Christian Environment. Very patient with new workers, willing to teach new employees
